articles.title: The Basics of Machine Learning
articles.content: Machine learning is a subset of artificial intelligence (AI) that focuses on developing algorithms and statistical models that enable computers to learn from data. In this article, we'll cover the basics of machine learning, including supervised and unsupervised learning, regression, and classification. We'll also explore some popular machine learning libraries and frameworks, such as scikit-learn and TensorFlow.
articles.author: Alice Johnson

articles.title: Building a RESTful API with Node.js
articles.content: RESTful APIs are a popular way to build web services that can be consumed by other applications or devices. In this article, we'll walk through the process of building a RESTful API with Node.js and Express, using MongoDB as our data store. We'll cover topics such as routing, middleware, and error handling, and show you how to test your API using tools like Postman.
articles.author: Bob Smith

articles.title: Responsive Web Design with CSS Grid
articles.content: CSS Grid is a powerful layout system that allows you to create complex, responsive designs with ease. In this article, we'll explore some advanced techniques for working with CSS Grid, including grid-template-areas, grid-auto-flow, and grid-gap. We'll also show you how to create responsive designs that adapt to different screen sizes, using media queries and the minmax() function.
articles.author: Jane Williams

articles.title: Getting Started with React Native
articles.content: React Native is a popular framework for building native mobile apps using JavaScript and React. In this article, we'll walk through the process of setting up a development environment for React Native, and building a simple mobile app that runs on both iOS and Android devices. We'll cover topics such as layout, navigation, and working with native modules.
articles.author: John Davis

articles.title: Building a Real-time Chat Application with Socket.io
articles.content: Socket.io is a powerful library for building real-time web applications, such as chat rooms and online games. In this article, we'll walk through the process of building a real-time chat application with Socket.io and Node.js. We'll cover topics such as setting up a WebSocket server, handling messages, and broadcasting events to multiple clients.
